s9.message: Click the Chrome menu button, then go to "Tools" and choose "Extensions".

s17.message: Make sure Adblock Plus is enabled.

s3.message: Select Firefox >> Add-ons (for Mac OS X / Linux, select "Tools" from the menubar >> "Add-Ons"), this will open your Firefox Add-ons Manager.

s1.message: I (accidentally) blocked something. How can I unblock it again?

s7.message: Remove the respective filters from the right window. This should unblock the desired element again.

s6.message: Right-click a group and choose "Show/hide filters" and this will show you the custom filters.

s5.message: At the top you will see the "Custom filters" tab where you find your own filters in filter groups.

s4.message: Click on "Extensions", find Adblock Plus there, go to "Options" and then click on "Filter preferences...".

s13.message: Click the "Menu" button (for Mac OS X / Linux, "Tools"), select "Extensions" >> "Manage Extensions".

s54.message: If anything did not help, please report the websites with unblocked ads in our forum.

s53.message: Sometimes resetting Firefox or creating a new browser profile for Chrome works wonders.

s52.message: It could be that a malicious extension in your browser injects ads into webpages. Please read this guide how to detect such extensions and get rid of them.

s51.message: I did all previous steps but I am still getting ads!

s11.message: Go to the "Add your own filters" tab. Here you can remove the custom filters.

s27.message: Click on "Extensions", find Adblock Plus there, go to "Options" and click on "Filter preferences...".

s19.message: Select Firefox >> Add-ons (for Mac OS X / Linux, select "Tools" from the menubar >> "Add-Ons"), this will open your Firefox Add-ons Manager. Click on "Extensions", find Adblock Plus there, go to "Options" and then ensure "Disable everywhere" is unchecked.

s39.message: Select Firefox >> Add-ons (for Mac OS X / Linux, select "Tools" from the menubar >> "Add-Ons"), this will open your Firefox Add-ons Manager.

s24.message: Make sure you are subscribed to a filter subscription.

s35.message: Find Adblock Plus there, click its small tool-icon on the right side and choose "Preferences".

s34.message: Click the "Menu" button (for Mac OS X / Linux, "Tools"), select "Extensions" >> "Manage Extensions" .

s37.message: Make sure Adblock Plus does not whitelist the website.

s10.message: Find Adblock Plus there and click on "Options" under its description.

s31.message: Find Adblock Plus there, click "Options" below its description.

s16.message: I have Adblock Plus but I am still getting ads! Why?

s14.message: Find Adblock Plus there and click its small tool-icon on the right side and choose "Preferences".

s32.message: Make sure there is a filter subscription ("EasyList" or "Fanboy's Adblock List") that is enabled (ticked):

s30.message: Click the Chrome menu button, then go to "Tools" and choose "Extensions" (for Mac OS X / Linux go to menubar "Window" >> "Extensions").

s23.message: Click the "Menu" button (for Mac OS X / Linux, "Tools"), select "Extensions" >> "Manage Extensions". Find Adblock Plus there and ensure it is not greyed-out and enabled.

s45.message: Find Adblock Plus there, click "Options" below its description and then go to the "Whitelisted domains" tab.

s46.message: Ensure the text box does not contain any sites you do not want to see ads on:

s21.message: Click the Chrome menu button, then go to "Tools" and choose "Extensions". Find Adblock Plus there and ensure "Enabled" is ticked on the right.

s26.message: In Firefox select Firefox >> Add-ons (for Mac OS X / Linux, select "Tools" from the menubar >> "Add-Ons"), this will open your Firefox Add-ons Manager.

s41.message: Go to the "Custom filters" tab on the top, right-click "Exception Rules" (if it is there) and choose "Show/hide filters".

s42.message: Ensure the right window does not contain any sites you do not want to see ads on:

s50.message: Click the "Whitelisted domains" tab at the top and ensure the text box does not contain any sites you do not want to see ads on:

s28.message: Ensure there is a filter subscription ("EasyList" or "Fanboy's Adblock List") that is enabled (ticked):
